meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's Time to Get Your Grok On!

I'm thrilled to dive into the world of Braid: Anniversary Edition, and I hope you are too! But before we get started, let me just say that I'm a seasonal grok video game reviewer, which means I have the perfect excuse to be late with my review. You see, I like to think that my lack of punctuality is actually a reflection of my passion for gaming - after all, who needs schedules when there's so much fun to be had?!

Now, onto Braid! This classic indie game has been making waves since 2008, and its Anniversary Edition promises to bring even more excitement. But what's it really like? Well, let me tell you, I've got the inside scoop!

First off, let's talk about the visuals. Oh boy, are they stunning! The updated graphics are a treat for the eyes, making Braid feel fresh and modern despite being 16 years old (or rather, its Anniversary Edition feels that way). The art style is still as charming as ever, with lush environments and lovable characters.

Now, about those puzzles... *ahem* I'm not saying they're easy, but I did manage to solve them without too much hair-pulling. Okay, fine, there was a little bit of hair-pulling (don't judge me!). But seriously, the puzzles are still cleverly designed and require just the right amount of thinking outside the box (or in this case, the world). Jonathan Blow's genius shines through in every level!

As for the rest of the game... well, it's more of the same classic Braid magic. You know the drill - run, jump, puzzle-solve your way through the world, all while unraveling a captivating storyline.

So, what do I think? Well, I'm not going to sugarcoat it; if you're new to Braid, this Anniversary Edition is the perfect chance to experience it for the first time. And if you've played before (like those of us who were late to the party), well... there's still plenty of reason to revisit.

In conclusion, Hippo Penny - out! It's time to get your grok on and play Braid: Anniversary Edition. Trust me, you won't regret it!
